ABBV_2025Q2_7.original_quote: It's vital for us to leverage our distribution capabilities while considering AI interactions and how these will integrate with both our emerging portfolio and existing brands.

ACN_2023Q1_8.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2023Q1_8.original_quote: We believe that the current macro environment is making it even clearer to clients that they need to change more, not less, and that two of the five key forces of change that we have identified for the next decade: the need for total enterprise reinvention enabled by technology, data, and AI; and th
ACN_2023Q1_8.summary: Accenture believes that the current macro environment necessitates clients to undergo total enterprise reinvention, driven by technology, data, and AI.

ACN_2023Q1_9.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2023Q1_9.original_quote: Since the pandemic began, we've focused on building scale in markets around cloud, data, and AI because they're critical to building the digital core.
ACN_2023Q1_9.summary: Accenture has focused on building scale in cloud, data, and AI markets since the pandemic, highlighting their critical role in establishing a digital core for businesses.

ACN_2024Q4_10.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2024Q4_10.original_quote: For the full fiscal year, we had $3 billion in new GenAI bookings, including $1 billion in Q4, and for the full fiscal year, we had nearly $900 million in revenue.

ACN_2024Q4_11.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2024Q4_11.original_quote: We are implementing and managing a scalable platform powered by GenAI, enabling the agency to act on evolving cyber threats up to 60% quicker than with traditional technologies, including detection response and containment models.
ACN_2024Q4_11.summary: Accenture is managing a scalable GenAI platform that enhances the agency's ability to respond to cyber threats, improving response times by up to 60% compared to traditional methods.

ACN_2024Q4_12.speaker: Bryan Keane
ACN_2024Q4_12.original_quote: I just want to ask about GenAI.
ACN_2024Q4_12.summary: An analyst inquired about GenAI, indicating interest in the company's AI initiatives.

ACN_2024Q4_13.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2024Q4_13.original_quote: We're going into the year expecting another healthy increase in our bookings and revenue from that; also, that data will continue to become a bigger part of the building out of the digital core because one of the biggest limitations on using GenAI today is that our client needs data, and they have a
ACN_2024Q4_13.summary: Accenture anticipates increased bookings and revenue from GenAI, emphasizing the importance of data for clients to effectively utilize GenAI technologies.

ACN_2024Q4_14.speaker: Dan Dolev
ACN_2024Q4_14.summary: An analyst posed two questions regarding GenAI, reflecting ongoing interest in the company's AI strategies.

ACN_2024Q4_15.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2024Q4_15.original_quote: But what we are seeing is the continued trend of trying to save money on IT to free up the spending on areas of GenAI.
ACN_2024Q4_15.summary: Accenture noted a trend of companies aiming to reduce IT costs to allocate more budget towards GenAI initiatives.

ACN_2024Q4_16.speaker: Dan Dolev
ACN_2024Q4_16.original_quote: Can you touch on the GenAI services margin, how it stands versus your traditional business?
ACN_2024Q4_16.summary: An analyst asked about the profit margins of GenAI services compared to traditional business, highlighting the financial implications of AI services.

ACN_2024Q4_17.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2024Q4_17.original_quote: GenAI is still a small part of our business, and I wouldn't really think about it as having a particularly different margin profile at this time.
ACN_2024Q4_17.summary: Accenture acknowledged that GenAI currently represents a small portion of their business and does not exhibit a significantly different margin profile at this time.

ACN_2024Q4_18.speaker: Bryan Bergin
ACN_2024Q4_18.original_quote: On GenAI, can you give us a sense of the size of some of the largest individual programs have reached?
ACN_2024Q4_18.summary: An analyst requested information on the scale of some of the largest GenAI programs, indicating interest in the impact and reach of these initiatives.

ACN_2024Q4_19.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2024Q4_19.original_quote: But the deals in GenAI that were on average kind of sub-$1 million, you now have some that are above $10 million, that's still on the smaller end as we move into production and scale.
ACN_2024Q4_19.summary: Accenture highlighted a shift in GenAI deal sizes, noting that while most were previously under $1 million, some have now exceeded $10 million as they scale up.

ACN_2025Q1_20.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q1_20.original_quote: We had another milestone quarter in GenAI with $1.2 billion in bookings and approximately $500 million in revenue.
ACN_2025Q1_20.summary: ACN reported $1.2 billion in bookings and approximately $500 million in revenue from their GenAI offerings, indicating strong market demand and financial performance.

ACN_2025Q1_21.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q1_21.original_quote: GenAI continues to be a catalyst for reinvention across the enterprise and building out the data foundation necessary to capitalize on AI, as an increasing part of that growth.
ACN_2025Q1_21.summary: The company emphasizes GenAI as a key driver for enterprise transformation, focusing on building a data foundation to leverage AI for growth.

ACN_2025Q1_22.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q1_22.original_quote: Our work spans important agencies, and we believe we are exceptionally well positioned to support the federal government in its mission to ensure security, assist citizens, and enhance efficiencies, particularly regarding cloud technology, data, and AI.
ACN_2025Q1_22.summary: ACN positions itself to support federal government agencies by enhancing security and efficiency through cloud technology, data, and AI.

ACN_2025Q1_23.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q1_23.original_quote: We observe strong interest in Banking & Capital Markets, particularly concerning areas like GenAI, but there is still a lot to consider about future interest rate movements.
ACN_2025Q1_23.summary: There is notable interest in GenAI within the Banking & Capital Markets sector, although future interest rate movements are a consideration.

ACN_2025Q1_24.speaker: Darrin Peller
ACN_2025Q1_24.original_quote: Additionally, could you share any insights on your discussions regarding AI for next year?
ACN_2025Q1_24.summary: An analyst inquires about ACN's future AI discussions, indicating ongoing interest in the company's AI strategies.

ACN_2025Q1_25.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q1_25.original_quote: Regarding AI, in my discussions with around 30 CEOs over the last two months, I've noticed a strong interest in AI, though clients are at very different stages.
ACN_2025Q1_25.summary: ACN's executive notes strong interest in AI from around 30 CEOs, highlighting varying stages of AI adoption among clients.

ACN_2025Q1_26.speaker: Jim Schneider
ACN_2025Q1_26.original_quote: And then with respect to the AI work, you talked about some of the context of the client conversations you're having.
ACN_2025Q1_26.summary: An analyst seeks clarification on the context of client conversations regarding AI, reflecting the importance of AI in client engagements.

ACN_2025Q1_27.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q1_27.original_quote: Consequently, we are observing an acceleration in the data initiatives, which are crucial for leveraging GenAI.
ACN_2025Q1_27.summary: ACN observes an acceleration in data initiatives that are essential for maximizing the potential of GenAI.

ACN_2025Q1_28.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q1_28.original_quote: We offer our clients experienced talent, full-stack engineers, and innovative tools like GenAI and a platform called GenWizard.
ACN_2025Q1_28.summary: The company provides clients with experienced talent and innovative tools, including GenAI and a platform named GenWizard.

ACN_2025Q2_29.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q2_29.original_quote: We had another milestone quarter in Gen AI with $1.4 billion in new bookings and approximately $600 million in revenue.
ACN_2025Q2_29.summary: In the following quarter, ACN achieved $1.4 billion in new bookings and approximately $600 million in revenue from GenAI, showing continued growth.

ACN_2025Q2_30.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q2_30.original_quote: Our unique partnership model uses our library of AI and Gen AI assets to quickly deliver productivity, with the potential of generating over $0.5 billion in value to self-fund their reinvention.
ACN_2025Q2_30.summary: Accenture's partnership model leverages its library of AI and Gen AI assets to enhance productivity, potentially generating over $0.5 billion in value for clients to support their transformation efforts.

ACN_2025Q2_31.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q2_31.original_quote: Our efforts there have included multiple acquisitions, and we are harnessing agility along with data and AI to drive the transformation happening in the UK.
ACN_2025Q2_31.summary: Accenture is utilizing agility, data, and AI to drive transformation in the UK, supported by multiple acquisitions.

ACN_2025Q2_32.speaker: Keith Bachman
ACN_2025Q2_32.original_quote: On the first one, one of the previous questions was asking about AI, more from the demand side or revenue side.
ACN_2025Q2_32.summary: An analyst inquired about the demand and revenue aspects of AI, indicating a focus on understanding market dynamics.

ACN_2025Q2_33.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q2_33.original_quote: In response to the first question, what we’ve observed with Gen AI mirrors our experiences with new technologies in the past.
ACN_2025Q2_33.summary: Accenture's observations regarding Gen AI reflect their historical experiences with new technologies, suggesting a strategic approach to adoption.

ACN_2025Q2_34.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q2_34.original_quote: Additionally, our strong ecosystem relationships and leadership in Gen AI and technology are crucial to our resilient business model.
ACN_2025Q2_34.summary: Accenture emphasizes its strong ecosystem relationships and leadership in Gen AI as vital components of its resilient business model.

ACN_2025Q3_35.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_35.original_quote: We are a leader in GenAI with another milestone quarter of $1.5 billion in bookings and over $700 million in revenues bringing our Q3 year-to-date GenAI bookings to a total of $4.1 billion and revenue to $1.8 billion.
ACN_2025Q3_35.summary: In Q3, Accenture reported $1.5 billion in Gen AI bookings and $700 million in revenue, bringing year-to-date totals to $4.1 billion in bookings and $1.8 billion in revenue.

ACN_2025Q3_36.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_36.original_quote: Gen AI has been a catalyst for reinvention because the power of Gen AI has created the opportunity to meet challenges in new ways and is creating new opportunities to achieve even better results than any single technology in the Internet era and yet Gen AI alone is just a tool.
ACN_2025Q3_36.summary: Accenture describes Gen AI as a catalyst for reinvention, enabling innovative solutions to challenges and outperforming previous technologies.

ACN_2025Q3_37.speaker: David Koning
ACN_2025Q3_37.original_quote: And I guess my first question, Gen AI bookings remain very strong, but sequentially grew a little slower than in some previous quarters.
ACN_2025Q3_37.summary: An analyst noted that while Gen AI bookings remain strong, their sequential growth has slowed compared to previous quarters.

ACN_2025Q3_38.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_38.original_quote: The Gen AI demand continues to be very, very strong.
ACN_2025Q3_38.summary: Accenture reports that demand for Gen AI continues to be exceptionally strong, indicating robust market interest.

ACN_2025Q3_39.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_39.original_quote: In the realm of data and AI, we see great potential, and we have the capability to develop those skills in-house, even if the latest expertise is scarce among the companies we are acquiring.
ACN_2025Q3_39.summary: Accenture sees significant potential in data and AI, claiming the ability to develop necessary skills in-house despite a scarcity of expertise in acquired companies.

ACN_2025Q3_40.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_40.original_quote: As you sit here today, we all talk about the massive opportunity from AI.
ACN_2025Q3_40.summary: The executive emphasizes the vast potential of AI but does not provide specific details or applications.

ACN_2025Q3_41.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_41.original_quote: Leapfrog is this whole idea of AI: How can we be the first?
ACN_2025Q3_41.summary: The executive discusses the ambition to lead in AI innovation, but lacks specific initiatives or products.

ACN_2025Q3_42.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_42.original_quote: Although the focus has shifted primarily to AI, blockchain is still relevant in areas where it makes sense, like banking and industry-wide solutions, due to its importance for security.
ACN_2025Q3_42.summary: The executive mentions the relevance of blockchain alongside AI, indicating a focus on security in specific sectors.

ACN_2025Q3_43.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_43.original_quote: We continue to see the themes that I've been talking about, both the cost of building the digital core and embedding AI really getting into everything, from both customer to deep into the industrial space, driving energy efficiency.
ACN_2025Q3_43.summary: The executive notes that AI is being embedded deeply into various sectors, enhancing customer experiences and improving energy efficiency.

ACN_2025Q3_44.speaker: Jason Kupferberg
ACN_2025Q3_44.original_quote: Some other IT services companies have been saying that upwards of 20% or so of their code is now being written by AI.
ACN_2025Q3_44.summary: An analyst highlights that other IT services companies report a significant portion of their code is now generated by AI.

ACN_2025Q3_45.speaker: Julie T. Sweet
ACN_2025Q3_45.original_quote: Well, first of all, our guidance takes into account how we deliver and any effects on how Gen AI is being built into our commercial models.
ACN_2025Q3_45.summary: The executive states that their guidance incorporates the impact of generative AI on their commercial models, indicating a strategic integration.

ACN_2025Q4_46.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_46.original_quote: Our early and decisive decision in FY23 to invest significantly to become the leader in Gen AI with a $3 billion multi-year investment is clearly paying off as we capture this new area of spend for our clients.
ACN_2025Q4_46.summary: The executive reveals a $3 billion multi-year investment in generative AI, positioning the company as a leader in this emerging market.

ACN_2025Q4_47.speaker: Angie Park
ACN_2025Q4_47.original_quote: Our results reflect our relentless focus to consistently deliver on our shareholder value proposition while investing for long-term market leadership and reinforce our role as a trusted reinvention partner for our clients and a leader in AI.
ACN_2025Q4_47.summary: The executive asserts their commitment to shareholder value while investing in AI to maintain market leadership, suggesting a strategic focus on AI.

ACN_2025Q4_48.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_48.original_quote: By using AI to streamline operations, Ecolab is on a path to deliver an estimated 5% to 7% sales growth and 20% operating income margin without increasing costs at the same pace.
ACN_2025Q4_48.summary: The executive discusses Ecolab's use of AI to optimize operations, projecting significant sales growth and operating income margin improvements.

ACN_2025Q4_49.speaker: Tien-Tsin Huang
ACN_2025Q4_49.original_quote: Julie, I like your AI remarks.
ACN_2025Q4_49.summary: An analyst expresses appreciation for the executive's comments on AI, but does not provide any substantive insights.

ACN_2025Q4_50.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_50.original_quote: We do not see AI as deflationary.
ACN_2025Q4_50.summary: The company expresses skepticism about the notion that AI will lead to deflation in costs.

ACN_2025Q4_51.speaker: Dave Koning
ACN_2025Q4_51.original_quote: Great job and great to see Gen AI bookings reaccelerate.
ACN_2025Q4_51.summary: The analyst highlights a positive trend in bookings related to Generative AI, indicating a resurgence in demand.

ACN_2025Q4_52.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_52.original_quote: They want the cost takeout, but they want to use everything we've invested in our platforms to get them to the advanced AI.
ACN_2025Q4_52.summary: Accenture emphasizes the importance of leveraging their existing platforms to help clients achieve advanced AI capabilities while also focusing on cost reduction.

ACN_2025Q4_53.speaker: James Faucette
ACN_2025Q4_53.original_quote: You mentioned, and we saw the reacceleration in Gen AI and bookings, et cetera.
ACN_2025Q4_53.summary: The analyst notes a reacceleration in Generative AI bookings, reflecting growing interest and investment.

ACN_2025Q4_54.speaker: Angie Park
ACN_2025Q4_54.original_quote: For our Gen AI projects and the pure Gen AI that we've been, or advanced AI that we've been talking about, we do see pricing that is accretive overall to Accenture's average.
ACN_2025Q4_54.summary: Accenture reports that their Generative AI projects are yielding pricing that positively impacts their overall average, suggesting strong demand and value.

ACN_2025Q4_55.speaker: Jamie Friedman
ACN_2025Q4_55.original_quote: I wanted to ask, Julie, about the way you're defining advanced AI.
ACN_2025Q4_55.summary: An analyst seeks clarification on how Accenture defines 'advanced AI', indicating interest in their strategic approach.

ACN_2025Q4_56.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_56.original_quote: In fact, one out of every two projects in Gen AI, Agentic AI, physical AI has significant data pull-through.
ACN_2025Q4_56.summary: Accenture reveals that half of their Generative AI projects involve significant data integration, highlighting the data-driven nature of their AI initiatives.

ACN_2025Q4_57.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_57.original_quote: Also, remember that when we went into this, we'd already trained about 500,000 of our people on classical AI because going back to FY2019, we said the next decade would be about cloud, data, and AI.
ACN_2025Q4_57.summary: The executive mentions that Accenture has trained around 500,000 employees on classical AI, aligning with their long-term strategy focused on cloud, data, and AI.

ACN_2025Q4_58.speaker: Bryan Bergin
ACN_2025Q4_58.original_quote: My first question on Gen AI impact.
ACN_2025Q4_58.summary: An analyst inquires about the impact of Generative AI, reflecting the ongoing interest in its implications for the company.

ACN_2025Q4_59.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_59.original_quote: In fact, especially early on, because Gen AI seemed so simple, right?
ACN_2025Q4_59.summary: The executive comments on the initial simplicity of Generative AI, suggesting a perception of its accessibility and potential.

ACN_2025Q4_60.speaker: Bryan Bergin
ACN_2025Q4_60.original_quote: I'm specifically curious if you see that combined with Gen AI adoption internally allowing you to operate at a sustainably higher utilization as that did take up this quarter.
ACN_2025Q4_60.summary: Accenture is exploring the impact of Generative AI on their internal operations, particularly in enhancing utilization rates, although they have not observed a structural change in utilization due to AI yet.

ACN_2025Q4_61.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_61.original_quote: That's one of the reasons why we have the new reinvention services to really simplify how we're operating because that makes it much easier to start to use this AI.
ACN_2025Q4_61.summary: Accenture has introduced new reinvention services aimed at simplifying operations to facilitate the adoption of AI technologies.

ACN_2025Q4_62.speaker: Jim Schneider
ACN_2025Q4_62.original_quote: As a follow-up on that, if you could maybe talk about the net impact of AI you're using internally to optimize your own work, your own business, utilization.
ACN_2025Q4_62.summary: An analyst inquired about the net impact of AI on Accenture's internal optimization and business utilization, indicating a focus on efficiency improvements.

ACN_2025Q4_63.speaker: Julie Sweet
ACN_2025Q4_63.original_quote: Our utilization, we would expect to continue to move around in the low 90%, so we don't have a structural change in utilization due to AI.
ACN_2025Q4_63.summary: Accenture expects their utilization rates to remain stable in the low 90% range, indicating no significant structural changes attributed to AI.

ADBE_2024Q4_64.speaker: Shantanu Narayen
ADBE_2024Q4_64.original_quote: We had several new milestones with our AI innovations enabling us to add more than $2 billion in digital media net new ARR and surpass $1 billion in the ending book of business for Adobe Experience Platform and native apps.
ADBE_2024Q4_64.summary: Adobe achieved over $2 billion in new annual recurring revenue (ARR) due to AI innovations, significantly boosting their digital media business.

ADBE_2024Q4_65.speaker: David Wadhwani
ADBE_2024Q4_65.original_quote: We took a major step forward in FY2024 with the introduction of AI Assistant in Acrobat and Reader.
ADBE_2024Q4_65.summary: Adobe introduced the AI Assistant feature in Acrobat and Reader, marking a significant advancement in their product offerings.

ADBE_2024Q4_66.speaker: Anil Chakravarthy
ADBE_2024Q4_66.original_quote: The AI innovations we have delivered enable our customers to accelerate the delivery of personalized experiences at scale and have been built to satisfy enterprise governance requirements.
ADBE_2024Q4_66.summary: Adobe's AI innovations are designed to help customers deliver personalized experiences at scale while adhering to enterprise governance requirements.

ADBE_2024Q4_67.speaker: Dan Durn
ADBE_2024Q4_67.original_quote: We are proud of the performance we have driven in FY2024, delivering record revenue, EPS, and operating cash flows while aggressively investing in AI product innovation.
ADBE_2024Q4_67.summary: Adobe reported record revenue and operating cash flows in FY2024, attributing part of this success to aggressive investments in AI product innovation.

ADBE_2024Q4_68.speaker: Shantanu Narayen
ADBE_2024Q4_68.original_quote: This quarter, Adobe was once again recognized for our exceptional culture and leadership, including on Forbes' World's Best Employers, Fortune's 50 AI Innovators, and Fortune's Best Workplaces in Technology in the Wall Street Journal's Best Managed Companies list.
ADBE_2024Q4_68.summary: Adobe's exceptional culture and leadership were recognized in various rankings, highlighting their focus on AI innovation as a key aspect of their workplace environment.

ADBE_2024Q4_69.speaker: David Wadhwani
ADBE_2024Q4_69.original_quote: So AI obviously has been a huge area of focus for us, and, frankly, our community has been using it at amazing rates.
ADBE_2024Q4_69.summary: Adobe emphasized the significant focus on AI within the company, noting that their community has been utilizing AI at remarkable rates.

ADBE_2024Q4_70.speaker: Dan Durn
ADBE_2024Q4_70.original_quote: We called out products like Express, AI Assistant, Firefly, premium tiers in DX, Gen Studio.
ADBE_2024Q4_70.summary: Adobe is highlighting its AI products like Express, AI Assistant, Firefly, and Gen Studio as key components of its offerings.

ADBE_2024Q4_71.speaker: Alex Zukin
ADBE_2024Q4_71.original_quote: I guess maybe to the point that you just alluded to in terms of AI being meaningful as part of the broader roadmap for business.
ADBE_2024Q4_71.summary: An analyst notes the importance of AI in Adobe's broader business roadmap.

ADBE_2024Q4_72.speaker: David Wadhwani
ADBE_2024Q4_72.original_quote: We've done a number of partnerships that we talked about with Box, ChatGPT, HubSpot, and others, but also our own products like Acrobat Workflows, from Acrobat and Reader into Express.
ADBE_2024Q4_72.summary: Adobe has formed partnerships with companies like Box and ChatGPT, integrating AI into products like Acrobat Workflows and Express.

ADBE_2024Q4_73.speaker: Shantanu Narayen
ADBE_2024Q4_73.original_quote: I think to your bigger question about what's happening in the business, and as we think about it, you know, at the scale of the business right now, certainly, as this entire world moves towards generative AI, as David said, we're executing on both the proliferation play at the bottom with Express an
ADBE_2024Q4_73.summary: Adobe is focusing on the proliferation of generative AI, particularly through its Express product.

ADBE_2024Q4_74.speaker: David Wadhwani
ADBE_2024Q4_74.original_quote: In addition to that, AI Assistant has been really a phenomenal ad, you know, unlike many other players in the space, we don't require significant, you know, security and governance reviews because people can have conversations around the documents that they view.
ADBE_2024Q4_74.summary: The AI Assistant product allows users to interact with documents without extensive security reviews, enhancing user experience.

ADBE_2024Q4_75.speaker: Shantanu Narayen
ADBE_2024Q4_75.original_quote: So it's just another way much like AI assistance is of monetizing it.
ADBE_2024Q4_75.summary: Adobe views AI assistance as a method for monetization, indicating a strategic focus on AI-driven revenue.

ADBE_2024Q4_76.speaker: David Wadhwani
ADBE_2024Q4_76.original_quote: So we are looking at leveraging the power of this AI foundation in all the activities.
ADBE_2024Q4_76.summary: Adobe is leveraging its AI foundation across all business activities, indicating a comprehensive integration of AI.

ADBE_2024Q4_77.speaker: Shantanu Narayen
ADBE_2024Q4_77.original_quote: Given the innovation that we've had, I think as it relates to all three businesses that we have, the Creative Cloud with everything that we've done around AI, we have a lot of momentum going into the business and a really great diverse portfolio in terms of both the customers as well as our offering
ADBE_2024Q4_77.summary: Adobe's innovation in AI across its Creative Cloud offerings is generating momentum and a diverse portfolio.

ADBE_2025Q1_78.speaker: Shantanu Narayen
ADBE_2025Q1_78.original_quote: This strength is also reflected in our AI-first standalone and add-on products such as Acrobat AI Assistant, Firefly App and Services and GenStudio for Performance Marketing, which have already contributed greater than $125 million in business exiting Q1 fiscal 2025 and we expect this AI book of bus
ADBE_2025Q1_78.summary: Adobe's AI-first products like Acrobat AI Assistant and Firefly have generated over $125 million in business, showcasing their financial impact.

ADBE_2025Q1_81.summary: The Acrobat AI Assistant has seen increased user adoption and engagement due to new features like support for additional languages and contract intelligence, contributing to the growth of ADBE's Creative flagship offerings.

ADBE_2025Q2_97.summary: The executive mentions a 25% year-over-year growth in monthly active users across Acrobat and Express products, driven by the reliance on Acrobat AI Assistant.

ADBE_2025Q3_133.summary: The executive discusses Adobe's strategy to customize products for various customer segments, which includes a focus on AI-driven solutions tailored to specific professional groups.

AMD_2023Q1_150.summary: AMD is preparing to ramp up its supercomputing projects and cloud AI initiatives in the fourth quarter, indicating a strategic focus on AI development.

AMD_2023Q1_151.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_151.original_quote: Now as it relates to your question about MI300, look, we're really excited about the AI opportunity.
AMD_2023Q1_151.summary: AMD expresses enthusiasm about the AI opportunity related to its MI300 product, which suggests a focus on AI-driven solutions.

AMD_2023Q1_152.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_152.original_quote: I'm excited about having AI-enabled on our Ryzen 7000 series.
AMD_2023Q1_152.summary: AMD is integrating AI capabilities into its Ryzen 7000 series, enhancing the product's performance and features.

AMD_2023Q1_153.speaker: Joseph Moore
AMD_2023Q1_153.original_quote: For my follow-up, you mentioned interest in MI300 regarding generative AI.
AMD_2023Q1_153.summary: An analyst inquires about the MI300's potential in generative AI, highlighting the interest in AMD's AI-related offerings.

AMD_2023Q1_154.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_154.original_quote: I would say we have been focused on AI as a strategic priority for AMD for a considerable time.
AMD_2023Q1_154.summary: AMD has prioritized AI as a strategic focus for an extended period, indicating a long-term commitment to AI development.

AMD_2023Q1_155.speaker: Harlan Sur
AMD_2023Q1_155.original_quote: And in terms of other opportunities, there appears to be this trend towards more of your cloud and hyperscale customers opting to do their own silicon solutions around accelerated compute or AI offload ends, right?
AMD_2023Q1_155.summary: An analyst notes a trend among cloud and hyperscale customers towards developing their own silicon solutions for AI, suggesting a market shift that AMD could capitalize on.

AMD_2023Q1_156.speaker: Ross Seymore
AMD_2023Q1_156.original_quote: And pivoting for my follow-up on the AI side and MI300.
AMD_2023Q1_156.summary: An analyst follows up on the AI aspects of the MI300, indicating ongoing interest and potential developments in AMD's AI strategy.

AMD_2023Q1_157.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_157.original_quote: In terms of generative AI, we believe we offer a strong value proposition from a hardware perspective, particularly in terms of performance relative to cost, which indicates high market demand.
AMD_2023Q1_157.summary: AMD believes it has a strong value proposition for generative AI from a hardware perspective, emphasizing performance relative to cost amid high market demand.

AMD_2023Q1_158.speaker: Timothy Arcuri
AMD_2023Q1_158.original_quote: Lisa, there was a lot more talk on this call about AI.
AMD_2023Q1_158.summary: An analyst observes increased discussions about AI during the call, reflecting the growing importance of AI in AMD's strategy.

AMD_2023Q1_159.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_159.original_quote: And the way you should think about our AI portfolio is it's really a broad AI portfolio across client, edge, as well as cloud.
AMD_2023Q1_159.summary: AMD describes its AI portfolio as broad, encompassing client, edge, and cloud applications, indicating a comprehensive approach to AI solutions.

AMD_2023Q1_160.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_160.original_quote: And then we'll have the beginnings of our MI300 ramp in the fourth quarter for both supercomputing and some early AI workloads.
AMD_2023Q1_160.summary: AMD is preparing to ramp up its MI300 GPUs in the fourth quarter, targeting supercomputing and early AI workloads.

AMD_2023Q1_161.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2023Q1_161.original_quote: First, we have made substantial investments, particularly in networking and AI.
AMD_2023Q1_161.summary: AMD has made significant investments in networking and AI, indicating a strategic focus on these areas.

AMD_2023Q1_162.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_162.original_quote: So both the mix to cloud as well as the R&D expense has increased just given the large opportunities that we have across the data center and especially AI.
AMD_2023Q1_162.summary: AMD is increasing its R&D expenses to capitalize on opportunities in the data center, particularly in AI.

AMD_2023Q1_163.speaker: Harsh Kumar
AMD_2023Q1_163.original_quote: I wanted to ask you about your views on the inferencing market for generative AI 3+.
AMD_2023Q1_163.summary: An analyst inquired about AMD's perspective on the inferencing market for generative AI, highlighting industry interest.

AMD_2023Q1_164.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_164.original_quote: The highest demand at the moment is for generative AI and large language model inferencing, which requires GPUs due to their ability to support training of the most advanced models.
AMD_2023Q1_164.summary: AMD reports high demand for generative AI and large language model inferencing, which necessitates the use of GPUs for training advanced models.

AMD_2023Q1_165.speaker: Harsh Kumar
AMD_2023Q1_165.original_quote: But specifically, I was curious if you could talk about any wins or any kind of successes or success stories you might have on the generative AI side with MI300 or 250 series?
AMD_2023Q1_165.summary: An analyst asked AMD about specific success stories related to generative AI using the MI300 or MI250 series GPUs.

AMD_2023Q1_166.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q1_166.original_quote: So as we said earlier, we've done some really good work on MI250 with AI and large language models.
AMD_2023Q1_166.summary: AMD has achieved notable advancements with the MI250 in AI and large language models, showcasing its capabilities.

AMD_2023Q2_167.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_167.original_quote: On the hardware side, we announced our new Instinct MI300X GPUs designed to be the world's most advanced accelerators for generative AI.
AMD_2023Q2_167.summary: AMD announced its new Instinct MI300X GPUs, which are designed to be leading accelerators for generative AI applications.

AMD_2023Q2_168.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2023Q2_168.original_quote: Importantly, our leadership product portfolio, Datacenter and AI investment priorities, and financial strengths position us well for long-term growth.
AMD_2023Q2_168.summary: AMD's strong product portfolio and investments in data centers and AI are positioned for long-term growth.

AMD_2023Q2_169.speaker: Matt Ramsay
AMD_2023Q2_169.original_quote: And your company is in a great position to participate on both sides of that on the CPU strength, and obviously in the AI space.
AMD_2023Q2_169.summary: An analyst noted AMD's advantageous position in both CPU and AI sectors, emphasizing the company's dual strength.

AMD_2023Q2_170.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_170.original_quote: On the positive side, we are seeing an acceleration in AI demand in a few ways.
AMD_2023Q2_170.summary: AMD is experiencing an increase in demand for AI, indicating a positive trend in their AI-related business.

AMD_2023Q2_171.speaker: Matt Ramsay
AMD_2023Q2_171.original_quote: Your company is aggressively trying to ramp both the hardware and the software side of the MI300 programs to support AI.
AMD_2023Q2_171.summary: AMD is actively working to enhance both the hardware and software components of its MI300 programs to better support AI applications.

AMD_2023Q2_172.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_172.original_quote: If I could share some insights on our customer engagements, there's a strong interest in our AI solutions from various tiers, including major hyperscalers, large enterprises, and a new group of AI-focused companies that are innovative in their use of AI technologies.
AMD_2023Q2_172.summary: AMD reports strong interest in its AI solutions from various customer segments, including hyperscalers and innovative AI-focused companies.

AMD_2023Q2_173.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_173.original_quote: Furthermore, MI300X will start ramping up with large AI customers, along with MI250s being adopted by various customers for specific AI workloads that do not involve the largest language models or parameters.
AMD_2023Q2_173.summary: The MI300X is set to ramp up production for large AI customers, while MI250s are being adopted for specific AI workloads.

AMD_2023Q2_174.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2023Q2_174.original_quote: But we are investing in AI, Datacenter, and the strategic priorities we have which generate a much higher return on investment.
AMD_2023Q2_174.summary: AMD is investing in AI and datacenter initiatives that are expected to yield higher returns on investment.

AMD_2023Q2_175.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_175.original_quote: export controls, but we do believe there's an opportunity to develop products for our customer set in China that is looking for AI solutions, and we'll continue to work in that direction.
AMD_2023Q2_175.summary: AMD sees an opportunity to develop AI products for customers in China, despite export controls.

AMD_2023Q2_176.speaker: Vivek Arya
AMD_2023Q2_176.original_quote: And for my follow-up, just kind of a broader question on AI accelerators in the commercial market, so I'm excluding the Supercomputing, the El Capitan projects, et cetera.
AMD_2023Q2_176.summary: An analyst inquires about AI accelerators in the commercial market, indicating interest in AMD's offerings.

AMD_2023Q2_177.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_177.original_quote: So, I think maybe let me take a step back and just talk about sort of our investments in AI.
AMD_2023Q2_177.summary: AMD discusses its investments in AI, suggesting a strategic focus on this area.

AMD_2023Q2_178.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_178.original_quote: So, I think there was a question earlier about how much of the MI300 revenue was AI centric versus let's call it supercomputing centric.
AMD_2023Q2_178.summary: AMD is analyzing the revenue contribution of the MI300 from AI-centric versus supercomputing applications.

AMD_2023Q2_179.speaker: Christopher Rolland
AMD_2023Q2_179.original_quote: Hey guys, thanks for the question and more on the MI300 opportunity that you guys called out as a multibillion dollar growth opportunity, I was wondering if perhaps you could put a timeframe around that multibillion dollar opportunity but more specifically, have you guys ported over MI300 LLMs to MI
AMD_2023Q2_179.summary: An analyst asks for a timeframe regarding the multibillion dollar growth opportunity associated with the MI300, indicating its potential significance.

AMD_2023Q2_180.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_180.original_quote: For AI applications, what we're seeing now is MI300X.
AMD_2023Q2_180.summary: AMD is highlighting its MI300X product as a key component for AI applications, indicating a focus on this specific technology.

AMD_2023Q2_181.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_181.original_quote: And as we go into next year for the AI specific applications, we are more heavily weighted towards MI300X, just given sort of where the software is written.
AMD_2023Q2_181.summary: The company is emphasizing a strategic shift towards the MI300X for AI applications, aligning their offerings with software development trends.

AMD_2023Q2_182.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_182.original_quote: I will say the difference in AI deployments is, I think, customers are willing to go very quickly.
AMD_2023Q2_182.summary: AMD notes that customers are eager to adopt AI deployments quickly, reflecting a growing demand for AI solutions.

AMD_2023Q2_183.speaker: Harsh Kumar
AMD_2023Q2_183.original_quote: On my second one, can you help us think a little bit about the generative AI spend, let's say, if you can side press some kind of metric, and so, how many dollars of spend today are you seeing from your customers on generative AI for let's say each dollar of regular server CPU spend?
AMD_2023Q2_183.summary: An analyst inquires about customer spending on generative AI compared to traditional server CPU spending, indicating interest in quantifying AI investments.

AMD_2023Q2_184.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2023Q2_184.original_quote: There is no doubt that the need for generative AI solutions is extremely high, and significant computing capacity needs to be established.
AMD_2023Q2_184.summary: AMD acknowledges the high demand for generative AI solutions and the need for substantial computing capacity to support these applications.

AMD_2024Q3_185.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_185.original_quote: Turning to our Data Center AI business, Data Center GPU revenue ramped as MI300X adoption expanded with cloud, OEM, and AI customers.
AMD_2024Q3_185.summary: AMD reports a revenue increase in its Data Center AI business, driven by the expanding adoption of the MI300X among various customer segments.

AMD_2024Q3_186.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2024Q3_186.original_quote: Importantly, we are making a strategic investment to position AMD as the end-to-end AI infrastructure leader and drive long-term profitable growth.
AMD_2024Q3_186.summary: The company is making strategic investments to establish itself as a leader in end-to-end AI infrastructure, aiming for long-term growth.

AMD_2024Q3_187.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_187.original_quote: Regarding 2025, we feel positive about the market based on our discussions with customers, who are significantly investing to build the infrastructure needed for various AI workloads.
AMD_2024Q3_187.summary: AMD is optimistic about the market for 2025, based on customer discussions about significant investments in AI infrastructure.

AMD_2024Q3_188.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_188.original_quote: I think we've done very well with our launches this year, both on the desktop Zen 5 launches as well as the notebook AI PC launches.
AMD_2024Q3_188.summary: AMD highlights successful launches of AI-enhanced PCs, showcasing their commitment to integrating AI into consumer products.

AMD_2024Q3_189.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_189.original_quote: So overall, we have a very strong top-to-bottom stack, and we do see some strength in the overall server market, which adds to some of the AI opportunity that we have.
AMD_2024Q3_189.summary: The company expresses confidence in its comprehensive product stack, which is positioned to capitalize on opportunities in the AI server market.

AMD_2024Q3_190.speaker: Ben Reitzes
AMD_2024Q3_190.original_quote: With the momentum you mentioned, is it the right CPU for GPUs, and are hyperscalers particularly appreciative of the ability to consolidate and make more space for AI equipment?
AMD_2024Q3_190.summary: The analyst inquires about the suitability of AMD's CPUs for AI workloads, particularly in relation to hyperscalers' needs for consolidating AI equipment.

AMD_2024Q3_191.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_191.original_quote: We believe that there will be strong AI content on CPUs, and that helps Turin as well.
AMD_2024Q3_191.summary: AMD executives express confidence in strong AI capabilities integrated into their CPUs, specifically mentioning the Turin architecture.

AMD_2024Q3_192.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_192.original_quote: We introduced our desktop products, including the Zen 5 and Ryzen 9000 series, as well as our next-generation AI PC Ryzen AI 300 products.
AMD_2024Q3_192.summary: AMD launched new desktop products, including the Ryzen AI 300 series, which are specifically designed to incorporate AI functionalities.

AMD_2024Q3_193.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_193.original_quote: For example, Meta mentioned expanding from inference on their large language models with Llama 3.1 to training workloads, and Microsoft has been an excellent partner in this journey.
AMD_2024Q3_193.summary: AMD references Meta's use of their technology for expanding AI capabilities from inference to training with large language models, highlighting collaboration with Microsoft.

AMD_2024Q3_194.speaker: Joe Moore
AMD_2024Q3_194.original_quote: I wonder if you could talk about the $5 billion of AI revenue, how that breaks down between training and inference, if you're able to assess that and just I know you sort of started off with most of the traction in inference, but you've seen some traction on the training side.
AMD_2024Q3_194.summary: An analyst asks for a breakdown of AMD's $5 billion AI revenue, focusing on the distinctions between training and inference workloads.

AMD_2024Q3_195.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_195.original_quote: So, look, there are lots of opportunities across the set of AI workloads.
AMD_2024Q3_195.summary: AMD executives discuss the various opportunities available across different AI workloads, indicating a broad engagement with AI applications.

AMD_2024Q3_196.speaker: Dr. Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q3_196.original_quote: There is good momentum around AI PCs.
AMD_2024Q3_196.summary: AMD executives note the growing momentum and interest surrounding AI PCs, suggesting a positive market trend.

AMD_2024Q3_197.speaker: Harsh Kumar
AMD_2024Q3_197.original_quote: In the coming year, let's say, 2025, your key competitor will take most of the TAM of the AI market, the GPU market, rough count, they'll take in something like $50 billion, $60 billion, you'll get another $5 billion to $10 billion, call it.
AMD_2024Q3_197.summary: An analyst predicts significant market share for AMD's competitor in the AI GPU market, while estimating AMD's potential revenue from AI at $5 billion to $10 billion.

AMD_2024Q4_198.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_198.original_quote: 2024 was an outstanding year, as we accelerated our AI hardware roadmap to deliver an annual cadence of new Instinct accelerators, expanded our ROCm software suite with significant uplifts in inferencing and training performance, built strong customer relationships with key industry leaders, and del
AMD_2024Q4_198.summary: AMD highlights a successful year in 2024, emphasizing the acceleration of their AI hardware roadmap and improvements in their ROCm software suite for AI performance.

AMD_2024Q4_199.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2024Q4_199.original_quote: We expanded gross margin by 300 basis points and achieved earnings per share growth of 25% while investing aggressively in AI to fuel our future growth.
AMD_2024Q4_199.summary: AMD reports a 300 basis point increase in gross margin and 25% earnings per share growth, attributing part of this success to aggressive investments in AI.

AMD_2024Q4_200.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_200.original_quote: I mean I believe that the demand for AI compute is strong.
AMD_2024Q4_200.summary: AMD is discussing the strong demand for AI compute, indicating its focus on providing the necessary computing power for AI applications.

AMD_2024Q4_201.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_201.original_quote: I think the DeepSeek announcements, Allen Institute as well as some of the Stargate announcements talk about just how much the rate and pace of innovation that's happening in the AI world.
AMD_2024Q4_201.summary: AMD is discussing its DeepSeek and Stargate announcements, highlighting the rapid pace of innovation in the AI sector, though specific applications or products are not detailed.

AMD_2024Q4_202.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_202.original_quote: And from a first half, second half statement, as I mentioned, we have some new important AI design wins that are going to be deployed with and MI300 and MI325 in the first half of the year.
AMD_2024Q4_202.summary: AMD is discussing new AI design wins related to their MI300 and MI325 products, which are expected to be deployed in the first half of the year.

AMD_2024Q4_203.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_203.original_quote: And on the notebook side, we also saw a number of our OEM partners launching new AI PCs with the slew of new bulk mobile part numbers that we announced at CES.
AMD_2024Q4_203.summary: AMD is collaborating with OEM partners to launch new AI PCs that utilize their recently announced mobile processors, showcasing a commitment to integrating AI capabilities into personal computing.

AMD_2024Q4_204.speaker: Harlan Sur
AMD_2024Q4_204.original_quote: Networking is a very critical part of the AI infrastructure becoming even more important.
AMD_2024Q4_204.summary: AMD emphasizes the growing importance of networking within AI infrastructure, highlighting its critical role in supporting AI applications.

AMD_2024Q4_205.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_205.original_quote: Networking is an extremely important part of the AI solution, and it's an area that we have been investing and spending quite a bit of effort with our customers and our partners jointly.
AMD_2024Q4_205.summary: AMD is focusing on networking as a critical component of AI solutions, investing significant resources in collaboration with customers and partners to enhance this area.

AMD_2024Q4_206.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2024Q4_206.original_quote: In the early part of 2024, there was a slight decrease in investments on the CPU side as companies focused their spending on AI initiatives.
AMD_2024Q4_206.summary: AMD notes a shift in investment focus from CPUs to AI initiatives, indicating a strategic pivot towards AI-related projects.

AMD_2025Q1_207.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q1_207.original_quote: Turning to our data center AI business, revenue increased by a significant double-digit percentage year-over-year, as MI325X shipments ramp to support new enterprise and cloud deployments.
AMD_2025Q1_207.summary: AMD's data center AI business has seen a significant year-over-year revenue increase driven by the ramp-up of MI325X shipments, which support new enterprise and cloud deployments.

AMD_2025Q1_208.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2025Q1_208.original_quote: Looking forward, despite ongoing macro and trade policy related uncertainties, we believe the investment we are making will position us well to address the large growth opportunities ahead as AI expands the use of high-performance computing across all our end markets.
AMD_2025Q1_208.summary: AMD is focusing on investments that will enable them to capitalize on the growth opportunities presented by AI, particularly in high-performance computing across various markets.

AMD_2025Q1_209.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q1_209.original_quote: So we're excited about the overall AI business.
AMD_2025Q1_209.summary: AMD expresses enthusiasm about the overall AI business, indicating a positive outlook on their involvement in the AI sector.

AMD_2025Q1_210.speaker: Vivek Arya
AMD_2025Q1_210.original_quote: And then longer term, Lisa, in the past you described I believe almost a $500 billion or so addressable market for AI accelerators.
AMD_2025Q1_210.summary: AMD is discussing a significant addressable market for AI accelerators, indicating a strategic focus on this area for future growth.

AMD_2025Q1_211.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q1_211.original_quote: But what I will say is on the AI diffusion side we're very actively working with the government as they're thinking through these rules and it's a very fine balance that we have to have.
AMD_2025Q1_211.summary: AMD is actively collaborating with the government to navigate the regulatory landscape surrounding AI diffusion, emphasizing the importance of balancing innovation with compliance.

AMD_2025Q1_212.speaker: Joe Moore
AMD_2025Q1_212.original_quote: Just an update on your thoughts on competing with custom silicon with A6 in AI space.
AMD_2025Q1_212.summary: The analyst is seeking AMD's perspective on its competition with custom silicon in the AI sector, particularly regarding their A6 product.

AMD_2025Q2_213.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_213.original_quote: Excluding the $800 million inventory write-down related to data center AI export controls, gross margin was 54%, marking our sixth consecutive quarter of year-over-year margin expansion led by a richer product mix.
AMD_2025Q2_213.summary: AMD is discussing the impact of data center AI export controls on their financials, specifically noting an $800 million inventory write-down. Despite this, they highlight a strong gross margin driven by a richer product mix, indicating a focus on AI-related products.

AMD_2025Q2_214.speaker: Jean X. Hu
AMD_2025Q2_214.original_quote: Operating expenses were approximately $2.4 billion, an increase of 32% year-over-year as we continue to invest aggressively in go-to-market activities for revenue growth and in R&D to capitalize on significant future AI expansion opportunities.
AMD_2025Q2_214.summary: AMD is investing heavily in research and development to leverage future opportunities in the AI sector, indicating a strategic focus on AI-related growth.

AMD_2025Q2_215.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_215.original_quote: We also experienced significant adoption of Ryzen AI during the first half, reflected in our sell-through numbers.
AMD_2025Q2_215.summary: AMD is seeing significant adoption of its Ryzen AI product, as indicated by strong sell-through numbers in the first half of the year.

AMD_2025Q2_216.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_216.original_quote: Yes, we are very excited about the AI opportunities presented by MI355 and the MI400 series as we move into the latter half of this year and into 2026.
AMD_2025Q2_216.summary: AMD is highlighting the AI opportunities associated with their MI355 and MI400 series products, indicating a focus on leveraging these technologies in the upcoming periods.

AMD_2025Q2_217.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_217.original_quote: So we're bullish on MI355 and where the AI opportunity is for us.
AMD_2025Q2_217.summary: AMD is optimistic about the MI355 and its potential in the AI market, indicating a focus on leveraging this product for AI opportunities.

AMD_2025Q2_218.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_218.original_quote: I think we're seeing a lot of positive signs in our AI customer adoption, I think the strength of the MI350 series, the very positive feedback that we're getting on MI400 from customers, the work that we're doing in terms of ensuring that we are fully ready for large-scale deployments of not just in
AMD_2025Q2_218.summary: AMD is experiencing strong customer adoption of its AI products, particularly the MI350 and MI400 series, indicating readiness for large-scale deployments in AI applications.

AMD_2025Q2_219.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_219.original_quote: We're seeing stronger forecasts for server CPUs as the demand for AI content necessitates the use of traditional CPUs.
AMD_2025Q2_219.summary: AMD is experiencing increased demand for server CPUs driven by the need for AI content, indicating a growing market for their traditional CPU products in AI applications.

AMD_2025Q2_220.speaker: Lisa T. Su
AMD_2025Q2_220.original_quote: However, we expect hyperscalers and neoclouds, especially those collaborating with large AI companies, to be key components of the initial ramp-up.
AMD_2025Q2_220.summary: AMD anticipates that hyperscalers and neoclouds, particularly those working with major AI firms, will play a crucial role in the initial ramp-up of their AI-related offerings.

AMD_2025Q2_221.speaker: Jean X. Hu
AMD_2025Q2_221.original_quote: So if we close the ZT sale and we'll get more cash, overall, our capital allocation principle continues to be the first phase, investing, especially with the tremendous AI opportunities ahead of us.
AMD_2025Q2_221.summary: AMD is focusing on capital allocation towards investments that leverage the significant AI opportunities in the market, particularly following the potential closure of the ZT sale.

AMD_2025Q3_222.speaker: Matthew Ramsay
AMD_2025Q3_222.original_quote: Lisa Su will present at the UBS Global Technology and AI Conference on Wednesday, December 3.
AMD_2025Q3_222.summary: AMD is participating in the UBS Global Technology and AI Conference, indicating its engagement with the AI sector.

AMD_2025Q3_223.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_223.original_quote: We expect this partnership will significantly accelerate our data center AI business with the potential to generate well over $100 billion in revenue over the next few years.
AMD_2025Q3_223.summary: AMD is discussing a partnership aimed at accelerating its data center AI business, with expectations of generating over $100 billion in revenue in the coming years.

AMD_2025Q3_224.speaker: Jean Hu
AMD_2025Q3_224.original_quote: Operating expenses were approximately $2.8 billion, an increase of 42% year-over-year as we continue to invest aggressively in R&D to capitalize on significant AI opportunities and go-to-market activities for revenue growth.
AMD_2025Q3_224.summary: AMD is significantly increasing its R&D investments to capitalize on AI opportunities, indicating a strategic focus on AI-driven revenue growth.

AMD_2025Q3_225.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_225.original_quote: I think we saw strong outperformance in both the server as well as the data center AI business.
AMD_2025Q3_225.summary: AMD is highlighting its strong performance in the server and data center AI business, indicating a focus on AI applications within these sectors.

AMD_2025Q3_226.speaker: Vivek Arya
AMD_2025Q3_226.original_quote: And for my follow-up, there is some industry debate, Lisa, about OpenAI's ability to kind of simultaneously engage with all 3 merchants and the ASIC suppliers, just given the constraints around power and CapEx and their existing kind of CSP partners and so forth.
AMD_2025Q3_226.summary: The discussion revolves around OpenAI's engagement with various stakeholders in the semiconductor industry, highlighting concerns about power constraints and capital expenditures related to AI infrastructure.

AMD_2025Q3_227.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_227.original_quote: We're very excited about our relationship with OpenAI, as it's a significant partnership.
AMD_2025Q3_227.summary: AMD is highlighting its partnership with OpenAI, indicating a strategic collaboration that may involve AI technologies or products.

AMD_2025Q3_228.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_228.original_quote: I think the interest in MI450 and Helios has just expanded over the last number of weeks, certainly with some of the announcements that we've made with OpenAI and OCI as well as the OCP show with Meta.
AMD_2025Q3_228.summary: AMD is experiencing increased interest in its MI450 and Helios products, particularly following recent collaborations with OpenAI and OCI, as well as announcements made at the OCP show with Meta.

AMD_2025Q3_229.speaker: Joshua Buchalter
AMD_2025Q3_229.original_quote: So you and your largest competitor in that space have talked about near-term strength, supporting AI workloads on general purpose servers from agentic.
AMD_2025Q3_229.summary: AMD is discussing its capability to support AI workloads on general-purpose servers, indicating a focus on enhancing their server offerings for AI applications.

AMD_2025Q3_230.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_230.original_quote: This leads me to believe that the demand environment is favorable because AI is driving a significant need for general-purpose computing.
AMD_2025Q3_230.summary: AMD is discussing the favorable demand environment driven by AI, indicating a significant need for general-purpose computing products that support AI applications.

AMD_2025Q3_231.speaker: C.J. Muse
AMD_2025Q3_231.original_quote: And I guess maybe, Lisa, to kind of probe kind of your growth expectations through '26 and beyond, and you talked about tens of billions of dollars in '27, can you kind of speak at a high level how you're thinking about OpenAI and other large customers and how we should be thinking about the breadth
AMD_2025Q3_231.summary: AMD is discussing its growth expectations in relation to large customers like OpenAI, indicating a potential significant revenue impact from AI-related partnerships and products in the coming years.

AMD_2025Q3_232.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_232.original_quote: The OpenAI relationship is extremely important to us, and it's great to be able to talk at the multi-gigawatt scale because I think that really is what we believe we can deliver to the marketplace.
AMD_2025Q3_232.summary: AMD emphasizes the significance of its relationship with OpenAI, highlighting its capability to deliver AI solutions at a multi-gigawatt scale, which suggests a focus on AI infrastructure to support large-scale AI applications.

AMD_2025Q3_233.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_233.original_quote: Stacy, I think our commentary was data center grew nicely year-over-year in both of the areas, both for servers as well as data center AI.
AMD_2025Q3_233.summary: AMD is highlighting growth in its data center segment, specifically noting an increase in demand for both server products and AI solutions within the data center sector.

AMD_2025Q3_234.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_234.original_quote: Data center will increase sequentially by a strong double-digit percentage, and both server and data center AI will also see growth.
AMD_2025Q3_234.summary: AMD is anticipating strong sequential growth in its data center segment, specifically highlighting growth in both server and data center AI applications.

AMD_2025Q3_235.speaker: Timothy Arcuri
AMD_2025Q3_235.original_quote: Lisa, I know it's only been a month since you announced this idea with OpenAI, but can you give us maybe some anecdotes of how this has influenced your position in the market with other customers?
AMD_2025Q3_235.summary: AMD is discussing its recent collaboration with OpenAI, indicating that this partnership may enhance its market position and customer relationships, although specific anecdotes were not provided.

AMD_2025Q3_236.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_236.original_quote: Firstly, the OpenAI deal has been in development for a while, and we're pleased to discuss it in detail, including the scale of the deployments and engagement, which are both multiyear and multi-gigawatt.
AMD_2025Q3_236.summary: AMD is discussing a significant multiyear deal with OpenAI that involves large-scale deployments and engagement, indicating a deep collaboration in the AI space.

AMD_2025Q3_237.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_237.original_quote: Some of this can be attributed to server refresh cycles, but from discussions with our customers, it appears that the rise in AI workloads is leading to an increased need for traditional compute, necessitating more build-out.
AMD_2025Q3_237.summary: AMD is experiencing increased demand for traditional compute resources due to the rise in AI workloads, which is prompting customers to refresh their server infrastructure.

AMD_2025Q3_238.speaker: Aaron Rakers
AMD_2025Q3_238.original_quote: As a quick follow-up, I'm curious and not to steal maybe the discussion from next week, but Lisa, you've been very consistent, like $500 billion of total AI silicon TAM opportunity and obviously progressing above that.
AMD_2025Q3_238.summary: The analyst highlights AMD's significant total addressable market (TAM) opportunity in AI silicon, indicating the company's focus on AI-related semiconductor products.

AMD_2025Q3_239.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_239.original_quote: But suffice it to say, from everything that we see, we see the AI compute TAM just going up.
AMD_2025Q3_239.summary: AMD is observing an increasing total addressable market (TAM) for AI compute, indicating a positive outlook for their AI-related offerings.

AMD_2025Q3_240.speaker: Antoine Chkaiban
AMD_2025Q3_240.original_quote: So I'd like to ask about whether the developing relationship with OpenAI could be a tailwind to the development of your software stack.
AMD_2025Q3_240.summary: AMD is exploring a developing relationship with OpenAI that could enhance the development of its software stack, indicating potential collaboration in AI-related projects.

AMD_2025Q3_241.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_241.original_quote: Our collaboration with OpenAI is particularly focused on working together on hardware, software, systems, and the future roadmap.
AMD_2025Q3_241.summary: AMD is collaborating with OpenAI to enhance their hardware, software, and systems, indicating a strategic focus on developing future AI technologies.

AMD_2025Q3_242.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_242.original_quote: Additionally, there is another trend emerging, indicating a growing demand for more AI computing resources.
AMD_2025Q3_242.summary: AMD is observing an increasing demand for AI computing resources, suggesting a focus on enhancing their product offerings to meet this trend.

AMD_2025Q3_243.speaker: Ross Seymore
AMD_2025Q3_243.original_quote: Lisa, this might take longer than the amount of time we have left before the top of the hour, but there's been so many of these multi-gigawatt announcements from OpenAI.
AMD_2025Q3_243.summary: The quote references the significant announcements related to AI from OpenAI, indicating a growing interest in AI infrastructure and energy requirements for AI operations.

AMD_2025Q3_244.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_244.original_quote: Well, look, what I see is actually this environment where the world needs more AI compute.
AMD_2025Q3_244.summary: AMD is highlighting the increasing global demand for AI compute capabilities, indicating a focus on enhancing their semiconductor offerings to meet this need.

AMD_2025Q3_245.speaker: Lisa Su
AMD_2025Q3_245.original_quote: I would say it was a unique agreement considering the current time in AI.
AMD_2025Q3_245.summary: AMD is discussing a unique agreement related to AI, indicating a strategic move in the current AI landscape.

AES_2024Q2_246.speaker: Andres Gluski
AES_2024Q2_246.original_quote: Today, I will discuss our results, the significant advancements we've made with large technology customers, and the work we are doing to incorporate generative AI in our portfolio to develop new competitive advantages.
AES_2024Q2_246.summary: AES is incorporating generative AI into its portfolio to create new competitive advantages, particularly in collaboration with large technology customers.

AES_2024Q4_247.speaker: Andres Gluski
AES_2024Q4_247.original_quote: Without timely access to power, there can be no AI revolution.
AES_2024Q4_247.summary: The company emphasizes the critical role of reliable power supply in enabling the advancements and applications of AI technologies.

AES_2024Q4_248.speaker: Andres Gluski
AES_2024Q4_248.original_quote: There is an unprecedented need for incremental energy to power the AI revolution in the United States.
AES_2024Q4_248.summary: AES highlights the growing demand for energy driven by the AI revolution, indicating a significant opportunity for their services in supporting AI-related energy needs.

AES_2025Q1_249.speaker: Andrés Gluski
AES_2025Q1_249.original_quote: Ultimately, we aim for two primary objectives: energy dominance and leadership in the AI race.
AES_2025Q1_249.summary: AES is positioning itself to achieve leadership in the AI race as part of its broader strategy for energy dominance.

ABNB_2023Q2_257.speaker: David Stephenson
ABNB_2023Q2_257.original_quote: Presently, we leverage AI in our product offering; we utilize it for our party prevention technology and various matching technologies.
ABNB_2023Q2_257.summary: ABNB is utilizing AI in their product offerings specifically for party prevention technology and matching technologies to enhance user experience and safety.

ABNB_2023Q4_264.speaker: Ron Josey
ABNB_2023Q4_264.original_quote: But then you also talked about being a leader in personalized AI.
ABNB_2023Q4_264.summary: The company is positioning itself as a leader in personalized AI, suggesting a focus on tailoring experiences or services to individual users through AI technology.

AFL_2025Q2_252.speaker: Masatoshi Koide
AFL_2025Q2_252.original_quote: We provide diverse digital services to customers, associates, and employees, ensuring the incorporation of new generative AI.
AFL_2025Q2_252.summary: AFL is incorporating generative AI into its diverse digital services aimed at customers, associates, and employees, enhancing their overall service offerings.

ABNB_2023Q3_262.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q3_262.original_quote: I generally think for sure, as Airbnb becomes a little more of a so-called AI travel agent, which is what I think all travel apps will trend towards to some extent.
ABNB_2023Q3_262.summary: Airbnb is positioning itself as an AI travel agent, suggesting a shift towards integrating AI capabilities in its travel app to enhance user experience.

A_2024Q3_253.speaker: Padraig McDonnell
A_2024Q3_253.original_quote: At the end of the quarter, we also announced the acquisition of California-based Sigsense, a start-up that uses artificial intelligence and power monitoring to help customers optimize their lab operations.
A_2024Q3_253.summary: The company announced the acquisition of Sigsense, which utilizes AI and power monitoring to enhance lab operations for customers.

AES_2025Q2_251.speaker: Andres Ricardo Gluski Weilert
AES_2025Q2_251.original_quote: One is the need to power data centers, what can be provided in the time frame needed to sort of win this competition for AI dominance.
AES_2025Q2_251.summary: AES is focusing on the energy requirements of data centers that support AI operations, emphasizing the urgency to meet these needs to remain competitive in the AI sector.

ABNB_2023Q2_258.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q2_258.original_quote: With AI, we can enhance reliability and improve our service efficiency.
ABNB_2023Q2_258.summary: ABNB is discussing the use of AI to enhance reliability and improve service efficiency within their operations.

ABNB_2023Q2_256.speaker: Mark Mahaney
ABNB_2023Q2_256.original_quote: I wanted to ask Dave about the financial impact of AI and Gen AI.
ABNB_2023Q2_256.summary: The analyst inquires about the financial implications of AI and generative AI for Airbnb, indicating interest in understanding how these technologies may influence the company's performance.

ABNB_2023Q3_260.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q3_260.original_quote: We're looking to leverage emerging technologies like generative AI, potentially transforming the Airbnb app into an ultimate travel agent.
ABNB_2023Q3_260.summary: Airbnb is exploring the use of generative AI to enhance its app, aiming to evolve it into a comprehensive travel agent experience for users.

ABNB_2023Q2_255.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q2_255.original_quote: Finally, I believe AI represents a once-in-a-generation platform shift, potentially even larger than the transition to mobile, and that we will be at the forefront of innovation in this area.
ABNB_2023Q2_255.summary: The company views AI as a significant platform shift, potentially more impactful than the mobile transition, and aims to lead in innovation related to AI.

AES_2025Q2_250.speaker: Andres Ricardo Gluski Weilert
AES_2025Q2_250.original_quote: As part of our construction efforts, we utilized our AI robotic solar installation technology, Maximo, which makes construction significantly faster, less labor intensive and more cost effective.
AES_2025Q2_250.summary: AES is leveraging its AI robotic solar installation technology, Maximo, to enhance the efficiency of construction processes, making them faster, less labor-intensive, and more cost-effective.

ABNB_2023Q4_263.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q4_263.original_quote: Third, there is a new platform shift with AI, and it will allow us to do things we never could have imagined.
ABNB_2023Q4_263.summary: The company acknowledges a significant shift in their platform due to AI, suggesting it will enable new capabilities that were previously unimaginable.

ABNB_2023Q3_261.speaker: Lloyd Walmsley

ABNB_2023Q3_261.summary: ABNB is focusing on innovating its search experience by integrating Generative AI, particularly in enhancing community features and co-hosting functionalities.

ABNB_2023Q3_259.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2023Q3_259.original_quote: First, I think that we are thinking about generative AI as an opportunity to reimagine much of our product category and product catalog.
ABNB_2023Q3_259.summary: ABNB is exploring generative AI to fundamentally rethink its product category and catalog, indicating a strategic initiative to innovate their offerings.

A_2025Q1_254.speaker: Padraig McDonnell

A_2025Q1_254.summary: Agilent is being recognized for its advancements in scaling AI alongside other technologies such as 3D printing and big-data analytics, indicating a commitment to integrating AI into their operations and product offerings.

ABNB_2024Q1_267.speaker: Brian Chesky

ABNB_2024Q1_267.summary: ABNB is utilizing AI to streamline processes and improve the overall user experience on their platform.

ABNB_2024Q2_269.speaker: Brian Chesky

ABNB_2024Q1_266.speaker: Eric Sheridan

ABNB_2025Q1_274.speaker: Brian Chesky

ABNB_2024Q4_272.speaker: Eric Sheridan

ABNB_2024Q4_272.summary: The company acknowledges the potential impact of AI on the industry landscape but does not provide specific details on its applications or strategies.

ABNB_2025Q2_275.speaker: Brian Chesky

ABNB_2024Q2_268.speaker: Brian Nowak

ABNB_2025Q2_277.summary: The company is considering launching an AI travel search feature as part of its major product initiatives for 2026, indicating a focus on enhancing user experience through AI technology.

ABNB_2025Q2_279.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q2_279.original_quote: However, we will be integrating more AI into the app next year, which we can confirm.
ABNB_2025Q2_279.summary: ABNB plans to integrate more AI features into their app in the upcoming year, indicating a focus on enhancing user experience through AI technology.

ABNB_2025Q2_280.speaker: Elinor B. Mertz

ABNB_2025Q3_282.speaker: Brian Chesky

ABNB_2025Q3_283.speaker: Kevin Kopelman
ABNB_2025Q3_283.original_quote: Should we expect that the focus for next year are the initiatives you've already been discussing today, such as hotels, AI integration, and the continuing of experiences and services?

ABNB_2025Q3_286.speaker: Eli Mertz
ABNB_2025Q3_286.original_quote: Therefore, you should expect us to balance investments across experiences, services, hotels, and AI while continuing to deliver strong performance from our core business.

ABNB_2025Q3_285.speaker: Brian Chesky

ABNB_2025Q3_290.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q3_290.original_quote: As for advertising, the travel search paradigm is changing due to AI advancements.
ABNB_2025Q3_290.summary: The company is acknowledging the impact of AI advancements on the travel search paradigm, suggesting a shift in how they approach advertising in the travel sector.

ABNB_2025Q3_289.speaker: Brian Chesky
ABNB_2025Q3_289.original_quote: As for third-party apps and our AI-powered search, I firmly believe that our own search experience remains unique and valuable while remaining open to partnerships.
ABNB_2025Q3_289.summary: ABNB is enhancing its search experience with AI capabilities, positioning it as a unique offering while also being open to collaborations with third-party applications.

AKAM_2024Q3_291.summary: Akamai is utilizing generative AI to improve the security features and user experience of its Guardicore and Web Application Firewall (WAF) solutions.

ABNB_2025Q2_276.speaker: Brian Chesky

AKAM_2024Q4_296.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q4_296.original_quote: We added GPUs for a variety of AI and media use cases.
AKAM_2024Q4_296.summary: Akamai has integrated GPUs to support various AI and media applications, enhancing their service offerings.

AKAM_2024Q4_297.speaker: Madeline Brooks
AKAM_2024Q4_297.original_quote: Specifically, does it relate to any of the newer products you've developed in AI or similar areas?
AKAM_2024Q4_297.summary: The analyst is inquiring about the company's newer AI-related products, indicating a focus on their developments in the AI space.

AKAM_2024Q3_293.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q3_293.original_quote: GenAI is already in the hands and being widely used by nefarious actors, and that's one reason why we're seeing a lot more attacks and penetrations.
AKAM_2024Q3_293.summary: The company is discussing the risks associated with Generative AI, highlighting its use by malicious actors which has led to an increase in cyber attacks and security breaches.

AKAM_2024Q4_299.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q4_299.original_quote: Yes, I think there's a lot of AI-powered at image normalization so that the various images have the same consistent size, quality image classification even for things like detecting disease in crops.
AKAM_2024Q4_299.summary: Akamai is utilizing AI for image normalization to ensure consistent size and quality in images, which includes applications in detecting diseases in crops.

AKAM_2024Q4_298.speaker: William Power
AKAM_2024Q4_298.original_quote: And I just I wonder if you maybe update on this, just as along the lines of the tone of conversations you're having, what kind of the pipeline looks like, just kind of the activity level you're seeing in terms of taking advantage of particularly some of these generative AI applications and inference
AKAM_2024Q4_298.summary: The analyst is inquiring about Akamai's engagement and pipeline related to generative AI applications and inference, indicating interest in how the company is leveraging these technologies.

AKAM_2024Q3_294.speaker: Frank Louthan
AKAM_2024Q3_294.original_quote: And is there any aspect of their new networks that they're building to support their AI partners that they're having conversations with you about, about implementing your capabilities and layering them on top of that network to help maybe deliver some of that AI traffic?
AKAM_2024Q3_294.summary: Akamai is engaging in discussions with AI partners about how to implement their capabilities on new networks designed to support AI traffic, indicating a focus on enhancing network infrastructure for AI applications.

AKAM_2024Q4_301.speaker: Mark Murphy
AKAM_2024Q4_301.original_quote: Maybe some of these AI applications are going to become more economically viable.

AKAM_2024Q3_295.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q3_295.original_quote: There's a couple of database partners, observability widely being sold, live encoding, transcoding, video packaging, WebRTC for interactive video, digital asset management, optimization of video, game orchestration, fleet management, DRM, Kubernetes, connectivity and auto scaling, server side ad ins
AKAM_2024Q3_295.summary: Akamai is integrating AI into various aspects of its services, including live encoding, transcoding, and video optimization, to enhance digital asset management and improve performance in video and game orchestration.

AKAM_2025Q1_302.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_302.original_quote: For example, in one proof of concept, a company's artificial intelligence application achieved 30% faster response times using our new Butte platform than they had with a hyperscaler.

AKAM_2025Q1_303.speaker: Jonathan Ho

AKAM_2025Q1_303.summary: The company is discussing the integration of agentic AI into their AI firewall, indicating a focus on enhancing cybersecurity measures through advanced AI capabilities.

AKAM_2025Q1_304.original_quote: There's a lot of attacks now that have been published against AI apps of all kinds, including agentic AI.

AKAM_2024Q4_300.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2024Q4_300.original_quote: It's important to highlight that this currently represents a $100 billion market, not factoring in AI or the significant new deal we've secured.

AKAM_2025Q1_305.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_305.original_quote: Ease of use has come up in several accounts, particularly with our new AI-enabled interface that can make the integration be a lot faster and simpler.

AKAM_2025Q1_306.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_306.original_quote: We're shifting for the force towards hunting now that we have products that a lot of new to Akamai customers need, for example, API security, segmentation, cloud computing, and they're going to need firewall for AI as well.

AKAM_2025Q2_310.speaker: Jonathan Frank Ho
AKAM_2025Q2_310.original_quote: With your AI commentary, what kind of opportunity are you seeing there?
AKAM_2025Q2_310.summary: The company acknowledges the potential opportunities presented by AI, although specific applications or strategies are not detailed in the commentary.

AKAM_2025Q2_309.speaker: F. Thomson Leighton
AKAM_2025Q2_309.original_quote: And of course, if you think about the impact of Gen AI, one of the sort of bad impacts in general is that it really aids the attackers.

AKAM_2025Q1_307.speaker: Tom Leighton
AKAM_2025Q1_307.original_quote: We have the market-leading solutions, and now we are adding in firewall for AI — just starting but a lot of customer interest there.

AKAM_2025Q3_312.speaker: Tom Leighton
